text: Follow the money and see how some lobbying works.  Our taxpayer dollars subsidize 8 of 10 ACA policies.  Millions of these dollars are spent by the healthcare industry to lobby and influence Congress and it works.  Laws are written and passed that benefit the industry, not policyholders.   Think it through.  In short, we pay ins companies to deny us coverage and increase our premiums and taxes.  That has gone on for too long and they need to be told no.  I will do that.  No more tax dollars spent on lobbying.  Vote me in to get them out.
No makeup, full quarantine look.  Nothing fake here, just a real candidate who will provide real representation.  I have a lot of supporters, including a Mom who likes to sew‚ù§Ô∏è. Thank you!

8 out of 10 ACA policies are subsidized with billions of our tax payer dollars.  Millions go to CEO compensation while we are denied care and premiums increase.  So much waste.  Under M4A you pay for your own healthcare and not everyone else's.  Take the socialism out of healthcare!  https://www.taxpolicycenter.org/briefing-book/how-much-does-federal-government-spend-health-care
Want to show your support for Veronica 2020? Try out our profile picture frame!

Here in New Jersey many of us pay nearly half our income on healthcare, one way or another. Cost continues to increase while benefits are reduced year after year. As a New Jersey licensed Property Casualty (including Health) underwriter for nearly twenty years, you can trust me when I say we are being ripped off. But many members of congress will tell you that we must keep private, employer-based insurance. Others will advocate for a public option. They all know that a single payer Medicare for All system is the best option for the American people, both financially and in actual care. But they continue to deny this because they rely on the profitable health insurance industry to support their reelection campaigns. Please visit https://www.veronica2020.com/issues for more information.
SCOTUS got it right this time.  This victory for transparency is a victory against corruption.   Know your donors, follow the money, and make the connections to who gets represented.  What a mess.
Good morning NJ!  We are growing! More  platform coming this week! Feels great to fight back!

Neither Democrats nor Republicans control Congress, money does. Voters and taxpayers don‚Äôt decide on legislation, money does. I am running to get the money out of Congress so that our representatives, regardless of party, can compromise and enact laws that benefit us the people. Between now and November, it will be my responsibility to work to earn your vote. Help me take the first step by signing my petition to get on the ballot.  https://www.veronica2020.com/ballot_petition

For anyone who is interested in campaign finance and how it affects legislation, this is a great place to start.  WARNING:  It will get you motivated to contact your candidates and insist this be a policy priority.

Imagine the medical bills resulting from Covid19.  Who will pay? Depends...did you contract the virus at work or elsewhere?  Ins companies have a long history of battling each other over which policy should respond and it is often up to the "insured" to prove whether they were injured at work or not.    Healthcare in our country is a mess on so many levels.  Navigating medical bills is exhausting.  First denials, then hours on the phone, then lost information, then more denials.  I've been there, done that TOO many times.  I so want to fight this fight.  When this nightmare is over, we will have a chance to rebuild and we need to get it right.  Vote me in!

2021 will bring soaring property tax increases, private health insurance premium increases and Worker's Compensation increases as well.  The healthcare insurance industry will be looking to recoup Covid 19 losses (despite net earnings of $23.4 BILLION in 2018) and they will go to their trusted source of revenue, our Congress, to get it.  We need representatives who will stand up to these special interests.  I worked in this industry for years and we are being ripped off.  We can do so much better.  Vote me in, I cannot be bought!

I am not a politician.  My words are not screened by a team of political advisors before I say them, they come from me.  My values are not influenced by mega-donors or special interests, they come from my life's experiences.  I am not loyal to any ideology, I am loyal to my family, my neighbors, and my fellow hard working New Jerseyans.  Some may call me unqualified but look around and see where some of our best "qualified" leaders have brought us.  I say we need more "unqualified" representatives in office, people like you and me who everyday have to make it work in a system that is rigged against us in so many ways.  I will fight for you because I am YOU.  My main issue is campaign finance reform because it is at the root of all issues.  You can't pass good legislation, no matter your stance, when lobbyist dollars stand in the way.  I  have ideas for New Jersey and will begin rolling out a more specific platform in the coming weeks.  You may not always agree, but I will always be honest and honesty is a qualification we need more of.  We cannot wait any longer for someone "more qualified" to come along and fix our government, we need to step up ourselves and WE ARE QUALIFIED!

Two quotes that apply:  "The earth is what we all have in common"~Wendell Berry and "Do the best you can until you know better.  Then when you know better, do better"~Maya Angelou   We do know better & we can do better.  I will stand up to polluters of all kinds...no more money, no more influence.

Bailouts for oil are not needed.  2018 saw $28 BILLION NET profit for the industry & they spent nearly $400M in lobbying & campaign donations.  They have done enough damage to our planet, people and purses.  No more!  We need Reps who will stand up to them and spend our tax dollars responsibly.  Vote me in to get them out!

I'm listening now.  This pandemic is revealing the realities of our for profit healthcare system.  This is wasted taxpayer dollars.  We can be so much more effective and save billions.  Nov 2020 gives us the opportunity to get Reps in who can commit to structural changes.  I want to be one of those Reps and will work only for NJ residents best interests not special interests.  This show ends at 11:00am.  I will be so worked up by then!

Our system is rigged and has been for a long time.  That can change.  In November we get a chance to elect representatives that will put OUR interests first.  Insist your candidate, regardless of party or office sought, not accept corp PAC money and that they will make campaign finance reform a priority.  veronica2020.com
Essential workers are heroes!  Our petition is up!  The sun is shining!  I cut my own bangs!ü•¥

This is unacceptable. This is why nothing changes. This really gets under my skin.  This is why I am running. Change THIS and we can change anything!  Vote me in!  Sorry, not sorry....I really do get fired up about THIS! üí™üèªüí™üèªüí™üèª

Waking up and checking online signatures counts is awesome!  Thank you to everyone who has signed so far!  Our grassroots, small donor campaign is growing.  We will get the money out and real representation in!
Want to show your support for Veronica 2020? Try out our profile picture frame!

Today marks the beginning of a new phase in our campaign. Governor Murphy has made electronic ballot petitions available to Independent candidates, which means YOU can help me get on the ballot. All you have to do is sign! While I hope I can count on your vote come November, signing this petition is not a pledge to do so. I understand that over the next several months, I will have to work to earn your support. In the meantime, please help us take the next step and sign my petition. https://www.veronica2020.com/ballot_petition

https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/14/opinion/covid-inequality-health-care.html?action=click&module=Opinion&pgtype=Homepage  I read this in today's NYT and it really got to me.  No one in office now is fixing this and that is why I am running.  All talk, no action! So much waste of our tax dollars.    After Covid 19 and in Nov we will have the opportunity to elect representatives like me who personally have suffered financially and physically from this waste.  I care and will do it better.  Vote me in!
Coming up at 11:00am.  Should be good.

This donation is almost the same amount of DISCLOSED compensation of Horizon's Pres & CEO from 2017.  I can only imagine what he really makes.   Since millions of our NJ tax dollars contribute to Horizon's $13B revenue, TOTAL compensation of all Execs should be easily accessible.  NJ residents deserve to know where their tax dollars go and I will fight like hell for transparency.  I have been denied care too many times.  Also, read the article, you still need to make sure any Covid 19 testing & treatment is in network...so much for choice!

Put me in office and I will tell these greedy lobbyists their claim is denied!  After "careful review" we have decided our tax dollars going into the pockets of CEOs will no longer be considered "necessary".  Special interests need to be told they cannot control congress.  It can stop!
Hello NJ! Watch for our petition this week.  Happy Easter to all who celebrate.  Please stay safe and healthy.

I can only imagine the financial nightmare that will follow physical recovery.    This current mess of a  healthcare system is the direct result of the industry's influence on legislation.  If we clean up our campaigns, we can have our representatives write common sense laws that will keep Americans more healthy AND save billions.

So many Pharma ads on TV.  I don‚Äôt like my tax dollars going toward private industry advertising.  Imagine if your taxes paid for car or fast food ads?!   No, that would be unacceptable. Why do we tolerate this?   Vote me in to get influence out.  It can be done!
veronica2020.com is not worried about losing big donors.  We EARN votes

Our persistent efforts to get ALL candidates equal access to electronic petition signatures has paid off!  Today Gov. Murphy issued EO 120 which enables our campaign collect petition signatures electronically.  We will be providing the petition when it becomes available in the next few days.  Not all lobbying is bad, we got it done!  Thank you to Gov. Murphy and in particular the staff in the Office of the Secretary for taking all our requests and followups seriously. https://nj.gov/governor/news/news/562020/approved/20200408a.shtml

I'm not a typical candidate. I'm a regular citizen trying to make a difference, and it's not often you see that in Congress. I'm fighting for people like you and me‚Äînot big donors or special interests‚Äîbut I can't do it alone. If you're ready to get the money out of Congress, roll up your sleeves and let's get to work. I will be by your side the entire time.
Rough start for Day 9...I had to save the Easter Bunny from Lolli.  Next save: Campaign finance reform.  I can do anything!

Day 8 looks like so many beautiful NJ mornings but it‚Äôs going to be a tough week.  Quotes help keep me positive. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt count the days, make the days count‚Äù ~ Muhammad Ali.  Stay home & stay safe.
We promised updates and we will be keeping our promises.  Week one officially under our belt. Excited for week two!
A comprehensive updated list including municipal breakdowns.  Please be careful, please stay home.

This gets under my skin big-time! At a time when Americans need health insurance coverage more than ever enrollment will not be opened.  Of course a profit driven healthcare industry does not want new customers during a pandemic.  This is a great example in at least two ways:  How powerful the industry is when calling in a solid and how broken healthcare is in the richest country in the history of the world.  At a minimum hundreds of thousands will die and I'm sure millions will lose everything due to medical bills.  There will be opportunity to do it right after this pandemic and I really want to be there when that happens.

Without a quorum the FEC cannot conduct business and that is very dangerous for our elections and democracy.  The more I research the more concerned I get.  We need structural change from the top down.  That will happen with a drained swamp being replaced by representatives who put people first and not special interest or big donors.
THIS is why campaign finance reform is needed.  THIS is why I am running! @representus

Our campaign is officially 1 week old.  I never thought I would run let alone run during a pandemic.   I'm a mother of 2 young adult children and am so concerned for their safety and  I'm a candidate who wants to make our State and Country better for them.  So many strong feelings that are hard to separate, but I am committed and will see this through.  We are making progress by connecting through social media and other networking.  When it is safe again, we will hit the road and that is where I put my hope.  We will recover and we can make it better than ever for all of us.   Stay home, stay safe.

I saw this earlier today while walking my dog.  This is such a difficult time.  There aren‚Äôt good enough words to express the sadness.  This image is how I feel right now.  It will get better but it just is so sad.

Day 6 and I've already been thinking about how NJ property taxes will soar after Coronavirus.  Many residents don't know how millions in premiums are built into their local taxes.  Check our your municipal budgets NJ!    Plus, our teachers, first repsponders and public employees contribute to cost sharing from their pay.  Benefits are not what they used to be for employees but they keep getting better for the healthcare industry.  NJ property taxes CAN be reduced!  Vote me in and I will fight like it's for my own children because it is!

A long and depressing testament to our healthcare system.  After this is over we will have the opportunity for real change and a chance to get it right.  We need real representation from those of us who are living AND paying for this healthcare nightmare and no more wealthy lobbyists calling the shots.  Vote me in and I will work my &^$ off to get us better and more affordable care.  It can be done!

A lot of news today about how the healthcare industry is responding to Coronavirus.  Tests are free (some) but the facility charges in the ER can exceed $Ks.  This pandemic will further expose the total dysfunction of our employer based healthcare system.  Just announced today, 365K UE new claims for NJ, most will lose HC ins too.  We deserve better & can have better in the richest country in the history of the world. Get me in, I will fight like *&%# to get this fixed.

Good morning NJ! ~ Here is something nice to know on a rainy cloudy day.   We have many state symbols and our state bird is the Eastern Goldfinch.  They love to eat sunflower seeds.  If you are able to get out during this pandemic, please keep an eye out for them, they are everywhere throughout our beautiful state.  Stay safe today.

I'm listening now and trying to get through.  Traditional campaigning is on hold and we are focused on social media outreach.  We will be ready to hit the ground when it is safe.  This also brings the need to protect our elections front and center.  veronica2020.com

"People can grow from adversity as much as they do from prosperity" ~ Andrew Yang.   Good morning New Jersey!  Starting our campaign during this pandemic is challenging but we are determined to bring Campaign Finance Reform front and center this election.  It is the issue that affects all issues.   We can get through this adversity together & prosper together.

Today I had to pay my monthly healthcare ins premium of $2,203.41 for a family of three Silver plan.  Then I pay towards my deductible & co-pays.  My healthcare costs in 2019 averaged $3,223.23 per month.  No one steps up to fix this, just more talk.  That is why I am running, get healthcare and pharma money out of our campaigns and THEN it will change!
Happy National Census Day.  Do your part to make sure we receive critical funding.

I am an ordinary citizen who firmly believes that both sides have great ideas and we can work together with civility.  During this pandemic we need to do just that and continue with respect when this passes.

Even with low approval ratings, candidates with the most money win 90% of the time.   NJ deserves better.  No big money or special interests here.  We are powered by small donations and commitment to real change.  Donate @veronica2020.com  Thank you!

Good  morning NJ!  Another day ahead under the new normal of Covid 19 - We try to stay positive and keep to a schedule. We would like to canvass door to door but that's just not possible, so we focus on social media.  Good news:  We are getting volunteers and donations.  Our grassroots campaign is right where it should be on Day 4.  Be the best you can today!

According to a recent opinion piece in USA today nearly 1/2 our tax dollars go healthcare.  The example cited showed a salary of $52K per year went to $22,474.00 in healthcare costs. In 2019 the health sector spent a record $594M in lobbying for 2019 and their investment pays off in the form of higher taxes for us!
Did you know our campaign has an Instagram? Give us a follow! @VeronicaforNJ2020 https://instagram.com/veronicafornj2020

"Americans still believe in an America where anything is possible" - Barack Obama / "All great change in America begins at the dinner table" - Ronald Reagan  Both quotes still true today.  My campaign is focused on what we have in common.  Campaign finance affects all of our issues.  We can have real change and it can be done with civility.  There will be no hateful rhetoric from our campaign ever.

Good morning NJ!  One small positive thought can change your whole day.  During this pandemic there are more ups & downs than usual.  We will be thinking of this as we begin our 3rd official day of campaigning and hope you do too.  Try to stay positive.

So....how much does it cost to run for a Senate seat in our Country?  In 2012 the average winning Senator spent over $10M & that does not include outside spending.  Since CU, outside money has accounted for 22% of spending, in 2014 this increased to 37% and a whopping 47% in 2016!  That is way too much outside influence on our campaigns.

"Because the ones who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do"....Steve Jobs.  Being a new candidate at this level is intimidating but I'm up for the fight.  So many issues, so many fights.  Hit hardest where it will have the most impact.  We are aiming straight for campaign finance reform....the root of all issues.

Campaign Finance:  Raising & spending of money intended to influence a political vote or referendum...Encyclopedia Britannica. In 2010 Citizen's United v FEC ruled that organizations such as corporations and trade unions were protected from certain spending restrictions by 1A rights.  This basically translates to money equals speech and opened the floodgates for massive and persuasive spending in our campaigns.  It is true that money talks but it should not be heard in our Congress.  We want campaign finance reform so we will have real representation for people.

Voting by mail in NJ is safe and easy.  Just complete and return your Vote by Mail application to your County Clerk at least 7 days before the election, but sooner is better!https://www.state.nj.us/state/elections/vote-by-mail.shtml

I am running to get the money out of Congress so that our representatives, regardless of party, can compromise and enact laws that benefit us the people. I want 2020 to be the year we return to civility towards one another and live the promise of democracy as it was meant to be.  #veronica2020 #moneyoutofcongress #veronicaforsenate #independentwoman

During the #COVID19 crisis, it has been proven that Democrats and Republicans CAN work together to get things done. The #StimulusPackage2020 was passed with bipartisan support. My hope is that #WhenCoronaVirusIsOver, we will continue cooperating to benefit the American people.

‚ÄúYou must do that thing you think you cannot do.‚Äù -Eleanor Roosevelt. This quote is always in my head and I am putting it into action. Today, I am announcing my Independent candidacy to represent NJ in our US Senate. I love our state and have lived here my entire life. We have problems to be sure but there are real solutions we can work on together. My campaign is about what we have in common, not what we disagree on. So please, wish me luck and follow us a we launch this effort to bring real change to NJ from the top down. Visit my website for more details. veronica2020.com #veronica2020 #moneyoutofcongress

My name is Veronica Fernandez and I am formally announcing my Independent candidacy for US Senate to represent our great state. Many of you already know me, and those who know me best know I am passionate about campaign finance reform. Both Democrats and Republicans have good ideas, but special interests and big donors control our Congress and that needs to stop. That is why I am running. I am determined to pass legislation to clean up our campaigns so we can work together again‚Äîregardless of party‚Äîto write laws to benefit people the way our founders intended. At this time, I ask for you to be hopeful. These are difficult times, but we are a tough people. Together, we can get through this and restore NJ to be the best place to live, work and raise our families. Please visit my website for more details. You can sign my petition, donate, and volunteer. Thank you. www.veronica2020.com #MoneyOutOfCongress
